Journal Story: I grew up near the trail and was never far from it's reach in NY. It's been a dream of mine for awhile now and I decided next year will be my thru hike of the A.T. I will be 26 then and by the time I reach Maine, it will be my three year craniversary. May 20, 2014 I had brain surgery to remove a tumor from my cerebellum. The trail will be extra hard on me as I have ataxia, double vision and nystagmus-but I love the A.T and will be walking for my own recovery as well as raising awareness for TBI and ABI survivors/brain injuries. www.facebook.com/ATThruRaven

Could not pass up the weather for this 10 mile day hike. Fall count = three2 slips on rocks1 on mud into a stream - stains everywhere 
https://www.facebook.com/ATThruRaven

8 mile hike today from NY52 to Taconic State Pkwy underpass and back, took me 7 hours and 5.5 falls. I don't have a car, I just hike to a point then turn back-it will be much nicer thru hiking =)
https://www.facebook.com/ATThruRaven

Day hike to Bear Mountain on the Appalachian Trail in NY. Good times with my pa, although maybe I suggest not going on a weekend? 
www.facebook.com/ATThruRaven

I moved two weeks ago- I used to live next to the trail in NY where it crosses NY52, now I'm by the metro north station. I'm three miles away, but still lovely.

9.2 mile hike today- met a few other day hikers and a dog at the shelter to feed peanuts to. 3 miles to get to the trail 3.1 miles SOBO- Telephone Pioneer Shelter 3.1 miles NOBO- AT Train Station facebook.com/atthruraven

10 miles NOBO to the NY CT border. Had such a creepy vibe on finding the trail to the abandoned insane asylum/cemetery that I did not go down there. Scary crows and the trail became way too eerie. Also in sad news I broke my 100$ carbon fiber trekking pole and apparently I smell awful <3

9.8 mile hike today, can't believe I've never been to cat rocks before.

(Reminiscing picture from Bulls Bridge CT) Beyond excited and looking forward to starting in Georgia. I finally decided on taking the approach trail (HYOH) and leaving no later then March First. Although I'm still trying to figure out how to travel down- train maybe?

9.8 miles, 25 degrees, I was mistaken for a thru hiker, met six backpackers, was stalked by two trucks after sunset and asked to a strangers NYE party.
Also booked my train - I leave Penn Station February 27 for Gainesville Georgia and I'm starting my hike March First.

I absolutely love all their products and they sent over this amazing box for my thru hike!!!!Gosh I remember going on short hikes when I was younger and packing their fruit to have once we reached the summit. Best way to hike.

Nine mile hike south and north- FIRST HIKE OF THE NEW YEAR!Finally got my base weight to 12.6 and testing out spot gen3.

I love shakedowns and carrying under 15lbs. I wish I could go ultra light, but I just cant figure that out : need to have a notebook and a book to read on the trail. I'm still waiting for my 2017 NOBO trail guide book, but it's nice to have been training with my 2013 guide. I guess that was the year the trail began to call me- just took awhile to hear. 
facebook.com/atthruraven

Over the weekend I gave my two weeks notice at work (Tractor Supply) and with leaving in less then a month for Georgia- I'm counting down the days. During my walk I aim to raise awareness and support for people with brain injuries (TBI's & ABI's), caregivers and research. I spent 9 days in the hospital after my surgery and needed months of outpatient and inpatient care during my recovery (which is still ongoing). My family and I were completely unprepared with what a brain injury means. In a moment my life changed and we needed help. Everyone thought - I survived- great - done. No.A brain injury is forever- recovery is ongoing. Although we may look fine, although I may hike mountains - my struggle in constant. I'm really hoping to share this story on my thru hike from Georgia to Maine. I'm hoping to explain a little better and help others see- we are not invisible. 
My goal is to raise at least one dollar for every mile I walk (over two thousand) to the organizations which have and continue to help me and thousands of others. 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

The next time I walk across the bridge during my thru hike this year I will have walked 1,403 miles to get there. I leave one week from today for Georgia!!facebook.com/atthruraven
THREE DAYS UNTIL I LEAVE FOR GEORGIA!!!facebook.com/atthruraven

Took the train from Bedford to NYC, then Amtrak at Penn Station. I had lunch in Bryant park and had a lady at the train station ask me for money. Honestly she was not short fifty dollars for her ticket and I told her sorry I have no money . And nothing compares to a sixteen plus hour train ride- train added time in the Carolinas, plus I was the only one to leave in Gainesville. The conductor asked are you walking the trail and I nodded. Yes I am. He put down a stool for me to exit (no platform) and I was on my way. Because my train was late my shuttle was too, I walked over to the Big Bear Cafe and sat down at the counter on a barstool. Oh my gosh, everyone was so nice, I was their first thru hiker and they paid for my meal. Amazing gravy,biscuit, toast and sweet tea. I'm so glad my train was late. Hiker hostel shuttle picked me up around 1030 and I'm here now exploring outside with their dog. The mountains in Georgia are amazing. I start the trail tomorrow!
Facebook.com/atthruraven

Nero day in Helen had to escape the rain.
I am loving the trail so far, tented only once I seem to prefer the shelters and I only hear the mice. Blood mountain was gorgeous and the trail magic is great in Georgia. I had an omlet and pancakes this morning at Unicoi Gap 
Facebook.com/atthruraven

Finally hit the 100 mile marker and taking a zero in town the weather was real bad at the end. Rock climb to the fire tower in the snow, I didn't think I would make it honestly. Best feeling in the world.

The trail has become a mix of snow and mud, which is not fun for my fall count. Good thing for laundry at the NOC and brownie sundaes. As we get closer to the smokies it's surreal how many thru hikers will and have already stepped off trail. Yes it's been hard (Albert Mountain), it's rained, snowed, I've been seperated from my friends, lost food to the ground - but I have never been happier and there is no place I would rather be. The other day JW said to me, you have already changed so much, now you look us in the eyes. I do think. No I know. This trail and the people here have already made me a stronger, better person. Facebook.com/atthruraven

March is brain injury awareness month and today is brain injury awareness day 3/22 I did an interview-thought I would share. Currently waking up at Stecoah Wolf Creek Hostel - amazing new place where we cooked pasta and biscuits during last nights thunderstorm.http://www.mytraumaticbraininjury.com/single-post/2017/03/22/Brain-Injury-Awareness-Day
Gatlinburg is so overwhelming - I really miss the small towns and my new home in the mountains. Facebook.com/atthruraven

Missed clingmans dome, went backwards for a day, overall hiked an extra 21 miles, returned to Gatlinburg and now back into the woods. Cannot wait to be over with the smokies and relax in hot springs. (Why do section hikers get to claim spots in shelters and why are there no privies??!!)Facebook.com/atthruraven

Who makes a shelter at the top of a mountain that can only fit six people?? Can I adopt Walnut Mt. Shelter? Alright update time: pushed 20 miles in one day to get out of the smokies, insane snow/rain/storm lost my trekking umbrella. Stayed at Standing Bear Hostel for resupply- been hiking-another snow/rain storm today but just got in and at another hostel in hot springs. Hoping to see my brother, Cass, and Cyrus tomorrow in town!!!
facebook.com/atthruraven

Never ending rain and still feeling sick has brought us to our second zero in Marion VA. I miss the trail especially after hanging out with the ponies at our shelter by the Grayson highlands. It's been busy since I left Erwin TN thou, solo hiked thru closed bear country and did a 26 mile day awhile ago into Damascus where I stayed at the broken fiddle hostel. Nap time. Love y'all. Facebook.com/atthruraven

VA is so beautiful I can't believe hikers get the blues here. Thought I would try something new - I will be staying here in about 10 days y'all can send me a letter, postcard or thoughtful package if you put hold for AT Thru Hiker Raven Estimate Arrival 5/9 437 Roanoke Road Daleville VA 24083

Peace, mountains and love 
Facebook.com/atthruraven

I have been under the weather for awhile- met a guy a few days ago who was taking his second zero in the shelter from feeling ill. I'm hoping I feel better soon - soup and relaxing tonight. Facebook.com/atthruraven
Halfway celebration with my ma visiting !!!! I really missed my family and NY pizza - oh my gosh the pizza down south makes me cry. Facebook.com/atthruraven

Flip Flopping back down started off with a fun road trip from CT-ME. We were running late for the bus from Bangor, I had to drop off the rental car while Nomad bribed the bus driver with $5 and a Snapple Apple. I then ran a mile to the bus which waited ten minutes, just for me. Then at Medway we failed to get a hitch and had to pay too much for a shuttle- turns out there was a crazy storm and all the power was lost in Millinocket. We arrived in the pitch dark at night to the hostel and stayed in the Springer Room. Katahdin was the hardest mountain I've ever climbed post surgery. It took me 16 hours and we arrived back down at 2am - amazing hike though. We had the sign all to ourselves- it was magical. Zero days for awhile for recovery and I need to buy new hiking shorts- mine are torn to pieces. Katahdin literally kicked my ass and I wouldn't have it any other way.Facebook.com/atthruraven
